definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: Don't look at it as people crucifying your coding style.
sentences.chinese: 不要把別人的檢查，看成是對代碼風格的苛求。

sentences.english: I know better than to be proud and demanding.
sentences.chinese: 不過我很明白識體，不至於會縱驕，也不會苛求。

sentences.english: So I never espect the company to give me a higher salary.
sentences.chinese: 所以我從不苛求公司會給我高工資。

sentences.english: And Wang Yizhou said what the"China School"really needs is the time and more study.
sentences.chinese: 王逸舟等表示中國理論水到渠成，不應急於苛求學派。

sentences.english: But at the same time the Chinese want their pound of flesh.
sentences.chinese: 但與此同時，中國人的苛求也在其間展現的淋漓盡致。

sentences.english: We should not judge the young writers too harshly.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應當對青年作家太苛求。

sentences.english: Stalin obviously had an acute and particular sense of history.
sentences.chinese: 史達林對於歷史明顯的有着尖銳與近乎苛求的觀感。

sentences.english: You don’t have to be perfect when retelling.
sentences.chinese: 複述的時候也不必苛求完美。
對人對事少一點苛求吧。

sentences.english: He also urged graduates not to lay out a rigid path for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他還呼籲畢業生不要對自己的未來道路太苛求。

sentences.english: But clearly, this demanding friend held a different idea of loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 但很明顯，這個苛求的朋友對忠誠有着不同的想法。

sentences.english: I don't want to be uncharitable, but she's not a terribly good cook .
sentences.chinese: 我並不想苛求別人，但她烹調的手藝也實在不敢恭維。

sentences.english: She was easy and undemanding and always had a quick reply.
sentences.chinese: 她是不苛求的，並且總是能迅速回應。

sentences.english: Doth God exact day-labor, light denied?
sentences.chinese: 神苛求白天操勞，光明卻不給？

sentences.english: Don't take yourself so seriously, no one eles does.
sentences.chinese: 別太苛求自己，別人是不會這樣對待自己的。

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to make extravagant demands/an unreasonable request
perfect (idiom); perfection/the best of all possible worlds/as good as it gets
to pursue (a goal etc) stubbornly/to seek after/to woo
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
see 求全責備|求全责备[qiu2 quan2 ze2 bei4]
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
